intro: Erechtites argutus var. glabratus, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in prairies and along roadsides. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture.
